intro: Echium albarracinense, commonly known as the Albarracin bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echium albarracinense is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
